definition: see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
Mt Tai 泰山[Tai4 Shan1] in Shandong/abbr. for Thailand
safe/peaceful/most/grand
correct/right/so/thus/like this/-ly

sentences.english: She always stays cool, calm and collected in a crisis.
sentences.chinese: 她在危急关头总是很冷静镇定，处之泰然。

sentences.english: He remained unruffled by the charges.
sentences.chinese: 他受到这些指控仍处之泰然。

sentences.english: But Hester ought long ago to have done with this injustice.
sentences.chinese: 但海丝特早就应该对这种不公乎处之泰然了。

cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
bear hardship with equanimity/regard wrongdoing with equanimity
to talk and laugh as though nothing had happened/to remain cheerful (despite a crisis)
calm/composed/at ease
calm/self-composed
calm/unruffled

to handle matters with ease (idiom)/to hold one's own
to dismiss with a laugh/to make light of
optimistic/sanguine/generous/magnanimous/open-minded
